Just FYI, if you want to purify impure aniline but for some reason you don’t have the ability to distill a great way is to use oxalic acid to form dianiline oxalate which is insoluble in water. You filter and can then recrystallize the salt from I think either ethanol or water and filter. The pure crystals can then be free based with sodium hydroxide or carbonate and using a sep funnel to extract and separate the pure aniline

Hello, this might be a weird question but I was wondering, what causes a double displacement reaction to take place? For example, in the reaction of copper sulfate and hydrogen sulfide : CuSO4(aq)  + H2S(g) --> CuS(S) + H2SO4(aq). The sulfate is already satisfied with the electrons from the copper and the sulfide is satisfied with the hydrogen. Does the sulfate want hydrogen's electrons more than copper? Why? thank you.

Excellent video! I feel that whilst solid KOH is often a good drying agent for organic bases, it can react with DCM solvent to form formaldehyde. This can react with your product so it might slightly reduce the yield. The reason I think this is happening is because the red color in the distillation flask is typical of the condensation reaction of formaldehyde and a strong base.
Thanks for uploading more Nile :)
